Package datastructures

Class HashTable<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructures.GenericArray<LinkedList<E>>
      • datastructures.HashTable<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - type of elements to store
    public class HashTable<E>
extends GenericArray<LinkedList<E>>
    Hash Table class, built from an array of lists of elements of type E.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HashTable​(int length)
      Constructs hash table with passed-in length.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean add​(java.lang.String key, E elt)
      Adds passed-in element to the table.
      boolean contains​(java.lang.String key)
      Returns true if there's an element in the table with the passed-in key.
      int hash​(java.lang.String key)
      Hash function returning position of element with passed-in key.
      static int hashModX​(java.lang.String key, int x)
      Hash function some int corresponding to passed-in key.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if there are no elements in the table.
      java.lang.String[] keySet()
      Returns an array with all the hash table's keys.
      E lookUp​(java.lang.String key)
      Returns the element in the table with the passed-in key or null if there were no matches.
      void putEltsInArray​(E[] o)
      Puts the elements of the hash table (that can fit) into the passed-in array.
      int size()
      Returns the amount of elements housed inside the hash table.

        public boolean isEmpty()

        Returns:

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(java.lang.String key)
        Returns true if there's an element in the table with the passed-in key. Otherwise, false.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if there's an element in the table with the passed-in key. Otherwise, false

      • add

        public boolean add​(java.lang.String key,
                   E elt)
        Adds passed-in element to the table.
        Parameters:
        key - key identifying elt
        elt - element to add
        Returns:
        true if element could be added. Otherwise, false

      • keySet

        public java.lang.String[] keySet()
        Returns an array with all the hash table's keys.
        Returns:
        an array with all the hash table's keys

      • putEltsInArray

        public void putEltsInArray​(E[] o)
        Puts the elements of the hash table (that can fit) into the passed-in array. The reason this is a "putEltsInArray" and not a "getEltsArray" is because Java doesn't allow you to create new generic arrays: they have to be passed in as parameters that are not generic.
        Parameters:
        o - array to write
